result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Chad A Johnson was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant will pay in full today.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Defendant will pay in full today.  Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

Per Statute 343.301(g) your operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles will require that vehicles owned and/or driven by you be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Must install a mandatory Ignition Interlock Device when defendant obtains an occupational license or regular license.  There is a $50 ignition interlock surcharge imposed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad A Johnson

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Matousek.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 1.  Count 2, and tracking citations, dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes.  Count 3 dismissed by operation of law.   Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Priors confirmed by the court.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of OWI 3rd, contrary to 346.63(1)(a).  Joint recommendation for:  $1,800.00 fine, plus costs.  Total 3,264.00.  125 days jail. Report by 6:00 pm today. 30 month DL revocation and IID.  Alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan.  Court ordered:  $1,800.00 fine, plus costs.  Total $3,264.00.  125 days jail.  Report by 6:00 pm today. EMP allowed, according to jail rules.   30 month DL revocation and IID.  Alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Pre-trial conference on October 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 24, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
NGP entered by the court.  PTC set for 10/5 and STC set for 10/24 at 3 pm.  NGP entered on citation.  Track.
Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver.  Defendant stated he understood.  Court found that defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to attorney.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Court advised the defendant of his attorney options.  He  will represent himself.  Right to attorney and waiver form given to the defendant to fill out.
